reference: Volume One, Issue One, Phile 5 of 8
title: Using MCI Calling Cards
historical_context: This article is from the early days of hacking culture, providing practical information on using calling cards for international calls, which was a common practice among phone phreakers.
short_summary: This article provides a step-by-step guide on how to use MCI calling cards for making international and local calls, detailing the necessary codes and procedures.
summary:
In this article, Knight Lightning from the 2600 Club outlines the process of using MCI calling cards for international dialing. The guide emphasizes the simplicity of the method, requiring users to dial an access number followed by their authorization code, and then the international dialing sequence. The article lists various countries served by MCI, along with their respective country codes, making it a handy reference for phreakers looking to make calls abroad without incurring high charges. 

Additionally, the article provides instructions for local calling using the same MCI service, ensuring that readers have a comprehensive understanding of how to utilize these calling cards effectively. This practical advice reflects the resourcefulness of the hacker community during a time when telecommunications were becoming increasingly accessible yet still fraught with potential for exploitation.
